item.title: #es @ 1485093980173963265
#en @ 1485075341156798465
item.description:
So, we presented a multiverse of theoretically based models and open data for when a hypothesis was supported, and @R__INDEX comes in and p-hacks a hit job to say we are guilty of confirmation bias, but we need more SEM skills?
Get real. Grow up. Bully tantrums are tiresome...

item.title: #en @ 1485075337235120134
item.description:
Though we concluded support for the hypothesis, we presented a multiverse that showed when it did and didn't work and posted output & open data.
The paper is here: https://t.co/eptWXDlm9i
The data are here: https://t.co/Ff4bwGxLtS
Does that look like confirmation bias to you? https://t.co/YztooXcAB6

item.title: #en @ 1484548800136069121
item.description:
17/24 Majority of The Graph‚Äôs queries currently come from the ETH ecosystem, but it supports 26 networks on the hosted service.
This chain agnostic feature positions it to be a universal open data layer for all of web3, regardless of the layer 1 or 2 devs decide to build on.

item.title: #en @ 1484548787284631553
item.description:
7/24 @graphprotocol enables ‚Äúdata composability‚Äù.
Over time, The Graph becomes an open data layer for Web3, where indexers ensure data is updated/live, and subgraphs are ‚Äúdata legos‚Äù, like the $ legos of #DeFi, that any developer can access and combine to feed their dapp.
